column4: where can I find the firewall rules that are set at system startup?
There are lots of firewall scripts on the internet that you could use/customize
You really need rules that meet your specific needs.
I need to delete annoyinh rules defined by ubuntu that make my network card very slow
defined by ubuntu?
yeah, somewhere it is setting some CONNMARK target tules
iptables -F   will delete them
Are you sure?
Something tells me you are barking up the wrong tree.
yeah I know how to delete, but I want to remove them permanently
Unless you have created one, or have installed a firewall application that created one, there should not be a firewall script, by default.
(...that is why I think you may be barking up the wrong tree.)  How do you know, or what makes you think there is a firewall script on your system?
because those rules are set
I installed this system just yesterday
iptables -L
What do you see....?
iptables -L |pastebinit
man I already delete them. They are on mangle table. I am still performing a "grep" to find them.
yea, well, that is the only way I would know how to find them... unless I had a clue as to what application created them.
Did you use the ufw command previously?
nope, I disabled it before, already looked at it. it's somewhere else.
ok found them, it was a previous installation of zentyal.
previous install of zentyal?  You said you "installed this system just yesterday".
